column2: Season, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was bitten by possibly a tick and had itching and reddness. No blood tests were taken before Dr. prescribed this drug. After approx 5 days on a 7 day run, my muscles began to spasm all over my body while cramping up at times. Also had severe pain in my joints and went to ER where they couldn't find anything wrong and prescribed pain pills and sent me home. After suffering 2 more days I remembered I had muscle relaxers left over from a previous Rx and after taking 2 of those my muscles began to relax. I also took pain pills which eased the pain. I may have had a reaction to the sulfa in this product, although I have no known allergies.

column2: want2getbetter, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Lucine, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Even my energy level started to return. I initially went to the DR starting to think I had Cancer I had no idea a kidney infection could wreak suck havoc on our bodies. I'm so glad I went. I now have to go back to another doctor to get this fixed... which if the original emergency room doctor had done his job right, none of this would have happened. Don't take it if there is any other antibiotic that will do the job.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I decided to leave a review since all other reviews I found were bad. I'm on day 4 of 10 days on SMZ/TMP for a infected cyst in my leg. I have had really no issues with this medication, for the first 2 days I had a few light headaches, that pain relievers (approved by my doc) eased. I did have nausea that at first I thought was because of the medication, but found out today that is most likely caused by positive pregnancy test. Mine is easy to take it is chalking, but unlike others I've taken, it in now way haves a bad taste.Hope this reviews help. Don't get to discouraged by all the reviews, all medication has its side effects, and many people don't know what they are allergic to until the take it unfortunitly.
